Job Title: Senior HVAC Technician

Location: Miami, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description: 
This is an extraordinary opportunity to come in at the ground floor of a fast growing, ultra-high impact CleanTech startup. We at Blue Frontier are racing to solve arguably the biggest sustainability problem in the world with our disruptive space conditioning technology and business models. Air conditioning is the fastest growing use of electricity in the U.S. and globally. If present trends continue, by 2050 air conditioning electricity consumption will be bigger than the combined electricity consumption of China and India today! 
Blue Frontier’s patented AC system combines liquid desiccant dehumidification with indirect evaporative cooling to reduce electricity use by up to 90%. The desiccant is recharged and stored when electricity is the cleanest or lowest cost, and later used to deliver cooling when electricity is polluting or costly. These features enable our system to solve an array of today’s largest sustainability problems while improving indoor comfort and occupant health. 
Working in the Business Development department and reporting to the Field Services Manager, the HVAC Field Technician will be responsible for supporting installation partners for the install, operation and maintenance of Blue Frontier HVAC units in commercial buildings. This will be a very hands-on role, commissioning and operating Blue Frontier’s Pilot systems at a number of sites.
To the ideal candidate, this position is an opportunity to bring novel products to the market with the potential to literally change the world for the better.  Roles and Responsibilities 
HVAC Field Installation, Service and Support 
Commission pilot HVAC units and monitor their operation to maximize customer satisfactionTroubleshoot pilot system issues in the field and provide resolutionWork with Product Development team to diagnose issues and develop resolution planUtilize strong customer and sub-contractor partner interpersonal communication skillsProvide sub-contractor partner technical support including assisting them to troubleshoot and solve system issues in the fieldCollect customer and contractor feedback and relay to Product Development/R&D Skills & Capabilities 
Education & Experience 
Minimum of 5 years as an HVAC Installation, Service or Repair technician, working for an HVAC installer or ManufacturerKnowledge and understanding of HVAC industry applications; ability to read and understand MEP drawings and specifications, and electrical, network, and control wiring diagramsKnowledge and experience working with HVAC control systems and data to diagnose and resolve system issuesKnowledge of industry-standard communication protocols such as Ethernet, Modbus, and BACnetStrong and verifiable general mechanical and electrical skillsSelf-motivated and with the ability to work in a team environment as requiredWell organized with good verbal and written communication skillsQualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United StatesValid drivers’ license with limited violations Compensation & Benefits 
Salary 
Highly competitive salary commensurate with the position and level of capabilities of the applicant 
Benefits 
Medical and dental insurance. Paid vacation and holidays.  Location & Travel 
This role will be based in our Boca Raton facility which is located close to Boca Raton Tri-Rail station. This role will include a requirement to travel to project sites across North America as required. : Provide a summary of the role, what success in the position looks like, and how this role fits into the organization overall.

Experience Level (if available): None
